sen.j: 縁側（えんがわ）は、日本の日本の住宅に独特の構造で、家屋の建物の縁（へり）部分に張り出して設けられた板敷き状の通路である。
sen.e: Engawa is a term used to refer to a wooden-floored corridor built along the outside of the house building, which is a structure unique to Japanese traditional houses.
Engawa is a term used to refer to a wooden-floored corridor built along the outside of the house building, which is a structure unique to Japanese traditional houses.
Engawa is a term used to refer to a wooden-floored corridor built along the outside of the house building, which is a structure unique to Japanese traditional houses.

sen.j: 庭等外部から直接屋内に上がる用途ももつ。
sen.e: People can go up into the house by way of Engawa directly from outside (from the garden, for example).
People can go up into the house by way of Engawa directly from outside (from the garden, for example).
People can go up into the house by way of Engawa directly from outside (from the garden, for example).

sen.j: 欧風建築では、ベランダ、ポーチといったものが意匠的には似通っている。
sen.e: The function of Engawa is similar to those of verandas or porches in the case of Western architecture.
The function of Engawa is similar to those of verandas or porches in the case of Western architecture.
The function of Engawa is similar to those of verandas or porches in the case of Western architecture.

sen.j: 障子が、薄明かりの中でその向こうの人や風景を見えるような見えないような曖昧さの中に感じることが出来る。
sen.e: Through shoji (translucent paper screen), although you cannot see clearly, you can still feel the presence of people or scenery on the other side of the shoji in the dim light.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Through shoji (translucent paper screen), although you cannot see clearly, you can still feel the presence of people or scenery on the other side of the shoji in the dim light.
Through shoji (translucent paper screen), although you cannot see clearly, you can still feel the presence of people or scenery on the other side of the shoji in the dim light.

sen.j: これと同じように、内でもなければ外でもないという縁側に、空間を仕切る意識が希薄な日本家屋空間独特の曖昧さの構造を見るという文化論も語られる。
sen.e: In a similar manner, it is sometimes said that an ambiguous characteristic unique to Japanese houses, in which intension to clearly partition spaces is weak, can also be found in Engawa, which is not totally outside the building but not totally inside the building either.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In a similar manner, it is sometimes said that an ambiguous characteristic unique to Japanese houses, in which intention to clearly partition spaces is weak, can also be found in Engawa, which is not totally outside the building but not totally inside the building either.

In a similar manner, it is sometimes said that an ambiguous characteristic unique to Japanese houses, in which intention to clearly partition spaces is weak, can also be found in Engawa, which is not totally outside the building but not totally inside the building either.

sen.j: 縁側には、濡縁とくれ縁がある。
sen.e: Engawa fall into two classes: Nure-en and Kure-en.
Engawa fall into two classes: Nure-en and Kure-en.
Engawa fall into two classes: Nure-en and Kure-en.

sen.j: 濡縁は、外側軒下に造られる、壁や雨戸がない簡易なものである。
sen.e: Nure-en is simple Engawa which is built under eaves and has no walls and no rain shutters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nure-en is simple Engawa which is built under eaves and has no walls and no rain shutters.
Nure-en is a simple Engawa which is built under eaves and has no walls and no rain shutters.
sen.cmt: simpleの前にaを挿入しました。

sen.j: 普通は土台に板かけをし、外側には、縁束を立て、縁かまちをわたして縁板が張られ固定される。
sen.e: Normally, Enzuka (short posts) are first disposed outside the building to stand up in a row, Engamachi (horizontal member) is then disposed to extend on the Enzuka, and En-ita (boards used to make the floor) are finally provided to extend between the edge of the house building and the Engamachi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Normally, Enzuka (short posts) are first disposed outside the building to stand up in a row, Engamachi (horizontal member) is then disposed to extend on the Enzuka, and En-ita (boards used to make the floor) are finally provided to extend between the edge of the house building and the Engamachi.

Normally, Enzuka (short posts) are first disposed outside the building to stand up in a row, Engamachi (horizontal member) is then disposed to extend on the Enzuka, and En-ita (boards used to make the floor) are finally provided to extend between the edge of the house building and the Engamachi.

sen.j: 持ち運びの容易にできる据え置く形式のものもある。
sen.e: Nure-en, which are portable and can be installed easily, are also available.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nure-en, which are portable and can be installed easily, are also available.
Nure-en, which are portable and can be installed easily, are also available.

sen.j: 濡縁の木材は、水による腐食や風化に比較的強いものである必要があり、合板やベニヤ板などの新建材は不向きである。
sen.e: Because wood used for Nure-en needs to be relatively durable to corrosion by water and weathering, new housing materials, such as plywood or veneer boards, are not suitable.
Because wood used for Nure-en needs to be relatively durable to corrosion by water and weathering, new housing materials, such as plywood or veneer boards, are not suitable.
Because wood used for Nure-en needs to be relatively durable to corrosion by water and weathering, new housing materials, such as plywood or veneer boards, are not suitable.

sen.j: 防虫剤や、防腐剤を塗る場合もあるが、人が暮らす場所に塗布できるものかを考慮する必要がある。
sen.e: Although insecticides and antiseptics can be applied, it is necessary to check if those chemicals can be applied to places in which people lead daily lives.
Although insecticides and antiseptics can be applied, it is necessary to check if those chemicals can be applied to places in which people lead daily lives.
Although insecticides and antiseptics can be applied, it is necessary to check if those chemicals can be applied to places in which people lead daily lives.

sen.j: くれ縁は、母屋の外側に下屋を造りその下に雨戸を立てて外部と内部の中間に位置する部屋としたようなものである。
sen.e: Kure-en is Engawa built by adding Shitaya (small roof) and rain shutters outside the house building to make a space like a room between the interior of the house and the exterior.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kure-en is Engawa built by adding Shitaya (small roof) and rain shutters outside the house building to make a space like a room between the interior of the house and the exterior.
Kure-en is Engawa built by adding Shitaya (small roof) and rain shutters outside the house building to make a space like a room between the interior and the exterior of the house.
sen.cmt: the exteriorの位置を移動しました。

sen.j: 多くは、基礎の上には造られず、柱を束石（礎石）の上にたて、その上に縁桁と呼ばれる丸太や方形木口の平行材を掛け、木造軸組工法をする。
sen.e: In many cases, Kure-en is not built on the base of the house building, but built on Engeta (circular or rectangular cross-section horizontal member) extending on posts which are placed on Tsukaishi (foundation stone) to stand up in accordance with the timber framework method.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In many cases, Kure-en is not built on the base of the house building, but built on Engeta (circular or rectangular cross-section horizontal member) extending on posts which are placed on Tsukaishi (foundation stone) to stand up in accordance with the timber framework method.

In many cases, Kure-en is not built on the base of the house building, but built on Engeta (circular or rectangular cross-section horizontal member) extending on posts which are placed on Tsukaishi (foundation stone) to stand up in accordance with the timber framework method.

sen.j: その下は、床組をし、長手方向に縁甲板等を張る。
sen.e: Under this structure, a floor supporting structure is built, and flooring boards are placed longitudinally on the supporting structure.
Under this structure, a floor-supporting structure is built, and flooring boards are placed longitudinally on the supporting structure.
Under this structure, a floor-supporting structure is built, and flooring boards are placed longitudinally on the supporting structure.

sen.j: 戸は、必ず雨戸と雨戸を収納する戸袋を設けるか、金属製か木製のサッシとする。
sen.e: As shutters, rain shutter doors and door pockets must be provided, or wood or metal sashes must be provided.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As shutters, rain shutter doors and door pockets must be provided, or wood or metal sashes must be provided.
As shutters, rain shutter doors and door pockets must be provided, or wood or metal sashes must be provided.

sen.j: これらを併用して防水設備をすることも可能である。
sen.e: It is also possible to provide these two types of facilities together as a water-proof facility.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also possible to provide these two types of facilities together as a water-proof facility.
It is also possible to provide these two types of facilities together as a water-proof facility.
